page.title: 10FARMING
page.content:
The land in this area of the survey is mainly agricultural. The farms are mixed, with some livestock and some acreage for grain crops. Some of the farms are very large and include the hillsides which are difficult to farm and are often left as rough grazing. There are a few small farms in the area.
The main livestock are cattle, both for milk and for beef, and sheep. Most fsrmers grow a variety of grain, some for animal feed and some for human consumption. Silage has become an important animal feed and more silaging than hay-making occurs.
